text: Guys been struggling for a few days now. I’m trying to setup a local development. I’ve created a project folder locally followed the instructions here - <http://designers.HubSpot.com/tutorials/getting-started-with-local-development|designers.HubSpot.com/tutorials/getting-started-with-local-development> But when it comes to hs init I get -bash: hs: command not found

Did you install the cli this way ?
```npm install -g @HubSpot/cms-cli```
Yes and also tried npm install <@UD3Q3BN77>/cms-cli

Yes you can use @fontface and provide the full path to the file.

In the past I’ve always placed the font files in the file manager and used the link there to link out to them.
In your console, your HubSpot cli seems to work. ( on the screenshoot above )
Can you upload files to your Design Manager ?

Scotts-iMac:fireprotection scott$ npm -v
6.11.3
Scotts-iMac:fireprotection scott$ node -v
v12.9.1

```Scotts-iMac:fireprotection scott$ npm install @HubSpot/cms-cli
npm WARN deprecated request@2.88.2: request has been deprecated, see <https://github.com/request/request/issues/3142>
npm WARN deprecated mkdirp@0.5.4: Legacy versions of mkdirp are no longer supported. Please update to mkdirp 1.x. (Note that the API surface has changed to use Promises in 1.x.)
npm notice created a lockfile as package-lock.json. You should commit this file.
npm WARN fireprotection@1.0.0 No description
npm WARN fireprotection@1.0.0 No repository field.

+ @HubSpot/cms-cli@1.0.11
added 416 packages from 297 contributors in 84.955s
Scotts-iMac:fireprotection scott$ hs init
-bash: hs: command not found
Scotts-iMac:fireprotection scott$ ```
id suggest using the directions at <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate#getting-started>
`npx` or `git clone` usually works a lot better than `npm i -g` imo
I’m not using the boilerplate though.
Your `npm install` command in the above is missing `-g` which is necessary for `hs` to be able to be run.
:point_up:  yea thats what `npx` aims to fix... basically runs once and doesnt pollute ur global modules forever
you might have to instal the cli tool using sudo
